subject: Commons Logging, Log4J and JUnit
msgSnippet: I am writing some unit test classes for a project I m working on.  I use Apache Commons Logging as a wrapper for Log4J but I keep getting the following error
messageBody:
I am writing some unit test classes for a project I'm working on. I
use Apache Commons Logging as a wrapper for Log4J but I keep getting
the following error messages when I run the tests:

log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger
(com.panoramicsolutions.ffl.model.HibernateConfiguration).
log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.

My log4j.properties file is as follows:

log4j.rootLogger=info, stdout, file


### direct messages to file junit.log ###
log4j.appender.file=org.apache.log4j.FileAppender
log4j.appender.file.File=junit.log
log4j.appender.file.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.file.layout.ConversionPattern=%d{ABSOLUTE} %5p %c{1}:%L
- %m%n

### direct log messages to stdout ###
log4j.appender.stdout=org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender
log4j.appender.stdout.Target=System.out
log4j.appender.stdout.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.stdout.layout.ConversionPattern=%d{ABSOLUTE} %5p
%c{1}:%L - %m%n

### direct messages to file hibernate.log ###
#log4j.appender.file=org.apache.log4j.FileAppender
#log4j.appender.file.File=hibernate.log
#log4j.appender.file.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
#log4j.appender.file.layout.ConversionPattern=%d{ABSOLUTE} %5p
%c{1}:%L - %m%n

### set log levels - for more verbose logging change 'info' to 'debug' ###

log4j.logger.org.hibernate=info
#log4j.logger.org.hibernate=debug

### log just the SQL
log4j.logger.org.hibernate.SQL=debug

### log JDBC bind parameters ###
log4j.logger.org.hibernate.type=info
#log4j.logger.org.hibernate.type=debug

### log schema export/update ###
#log4j.logger.org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl=debug

### log HQL parse trees
#log4j.logger.org.hibernate.hql=debug

### log cache activity ###
#log4j.logger.org.hibernate.cache=debug

### log JDBC resource acquisition
#log4j.logger.org.hibernate.jdbc=debug

### enable the following line if you want to track down connection ###
### leakages when using DriverManagerConnectionProvider ###
#log4j.logger.org.hibernate.connection.DriverManagerConnectionProvider=trace

# logging for PSL classes
log4j.logger.com.panoramicsolutions.ffl.servlet=debug
log4j.logger.com.panoramicsolutions.ffl.usecase=debug
log4j.logger.com.panoramicsolutions.ffl.model=debug
log4j.logger.com.panoramicsolutions.utility=debug

I have tried the following to get this working:

1) including log4j.properties on the classpath
2) removing it from the classpath and specifying
-Dlog4j.properties=<full path to file> on the Java command line

I also had to edit the Junit excluded.properties file to exclude
org.apache.commons.logging.* to get this far.

In the classes I define the Log variables as follows:

private static Log logger = Logger.getLog(<classname>.class);

This is really doing my head in as I can't see the log messages to
help debug a problem in the Hibernate configuration. Despite spending
hours searching the web and newsgroups for an answer I can't find one.

Can anyone help?

Thanks,

Charles.
